Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant with leaves that look healthy, showing it has enough water.
The student can draw a plant with leaves that look wilted or dry, showing it does not have enough water.
The student can illustrate the difference in appearance between a well-watered plant and a plant without water.
The student can use observations from the classroom or videos to show how plants need water to grow by creating clear illustrations.
The student can depict the effects of water on plant health as evidence that plants need water to live and grow.
